column3: The Waterside Shopping Center in Marina Del Rey houses a market, pharmacy a Starbucks and several family owned shops. Some are cute, some are just expensive. If you are in the area and need something it is a fine place to go, just like any other strip type mall. If you are looking for local fun, this is not it.Parking is free and you will find a spot.

Waterside has shopping, dining,, and a Ralph's market. There are a few restaurants and lots of parking. California Pizza Kitchen is the most popular place where there is usually a long wait for a table in the evening.
Very few restaurants and coffee shops. Starbucks and The Loft are the only two things that I enjoyed visiting at the Center. Hopefully more stores prop up soon.

column2: Great Place to spend some time and money
column3: If you are in the market to shop, well this place is just right up there. Great place to walk and see what they have to offer as well as shop and spend some funds. sd

column2: Not really a mall but local amenities
column3: Nice to look at if if you lived locally would be great for Bank, hair, Massage an a bit of shopping and groceries. It's not a proper mall in my opinion!

Great options to eat and shop, there is something for everyone in this mall. The Mendocino farms has outdoor seating by a cute fountain. Rainbow acres has an interesting organic menu. Chipotle, CPK and The Counter are other good options.

There's a bit of everything here a supermarket , clothes shops hairdressers , nail bar , and various food outlets including my favourite medicine Farms sandwich place ! Coupled with great parking and s Starbucks what more could you need !

Handy little strip of shops that is easily accessible via the free beach shuttle if you are staying in or near Marina Del Rey. It has a really decent sized Ralph's supermarket (grocery store) and a large bank and some lovely little boutique shops. The local information bureau is across the road .
